Responsibilities & Context Job Description: Baolee Security Service & Property Management Ltd. is looking for a qualified and bilingual Interpreter with a Civil Engineering degree or any other bachelor degree to bridge communication between our local team and Chinese project partners. The ideal candidate must have a strong civil engineering background and be fluent in Chinese (Mandarin) and English, with excellent interpretation, communication & written skills. Responsibilities: Interpret verbal conversations, technical discussions, and instructions between Chinese engineers and local site teams during meetings, site inspections, and day-to-day operations. Translate engineering drawings, construction manuals, safety protocols, and contractual documents from Chinese to English and vice versa. Act as a cultural bridge to avoid miscommunication and ensure mutual understanding between all parties. Assist project engineers and managers in planning, scheduling, and reporting progress to Chinese stakeholders. Translate written communication, including emails, memos, and reports, ensuring technical accuracy. Interpret safety procedures and ensure they are correctly understood and implemented by all team members. Participate in design and review meetings and prepare bilingual meeting minutes. Coordinate and accompany Chinese delegates or consultants during site visits and official meetings. Support the procurement team by interpreting technical specifications during negotiations with Chinese suppliers and manufacturers. Maintain accurate records of all interpreted meetings and translated documents for documentation and audit purposes. Provide technical advice to ensure engineering compliance according to project standards and specifications. Assist in preparing bilingual training or orientation materials for staff related to technical work, safety, and compliance. Serve as backup or support for civil site engineers in basic supervision, inspections, and follow-ups when required. Directly supervise and manage all on-site construction activities from start to finish. Oversee the work of subcontractors to ensure their adherence to project timelines and quality standards. Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports on project progress for management. Resolve any on-site technical issues or challenges that may arise. Maintain liaison with the local law enforcement agencies.
